CatDescriptText: Article about event published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February, 14, 1959, p. 21, partially reads: "...The Maurice Stokes "Night of Stars" held at Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall last Friday night drew a crowd of 600. More important, however, was the fact that the Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League, sponsors of the affair were able to turn over $1,750 to the Maurice Stokes Fund in Cincinnati.  Taking part in three hour affair Friday were some of the top entertainment talent in the area.  Also on hand were big-name sports stars.  Jimmy Brown, the pile-driving fullback from the Cleveland Browns, was on hand and spoke glowingly of his friendship with Stokes..."
TitMainTitle: Cleveland Browns football player Jim Brown, Mr. and Mrs. Stokes holding photograph of their son Maurice Stokes, and three other men, posed in Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall for "Night of Stars" benefit for Maurice Stokes fund, another version
